New Records: The Guardians scored five runs without an out, setting a new postseason record
Key Match Events: The Guardians opened with a 5-0 lead in the first inning
Lane Thomas hit a three-run homer on his first postseason pitch
Cade Smith and Emmanuel Clase shut down the Tigers in relief
The bullpen, unused for six days, performed effectively
Pre-Game Insights: The Guardians had six days off, including a rainout, but remained motivated
The Tigers were coming off a two-game sweep of Houston in the wild card series
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Stephen Vogt praised the team's performance and motivation
Tiger manager A.J. Hinch acknowledged the Guardians' strong start and pressure
Miscellaneous Highlights: The crowd was sold out and supportive
The Guardians' offense, including Kwan and Fry, contributed significantly
